p: The essential oil of A. conyzoides presented IC 50 against E. canis at a concentration of 200 µg/mL. This biological activity is due to the hydrophobic properties of essential oils as their compounds provide these oils with the ability to partition into the lipids of the cellular membrane of bacteria and mitochondria, disarranging the structures and making them more permeable (Alviano and Alviano 2009).
